@graph.creator: Maaß, Sandra
@graph.title: Relative und absolute Proteinquantifizierung in Bakterien
abstract: Bakterien, Proteine, Massenspektrometrie, Mikrobiologie, Staphylococcus aureus, Quantifizierung, Bacillus subtilis, 2D PAGE, generelle Stressantwort, Glukosehunger, Hitzestress

The aim of this work was the development and establishment of gelbased and gelfree methods for relative and absolute protein quantification. These methods were used in follow-up studies investigating physiological relevant issues in bacteria. Therefore 2D PAGE and mass spectrometry-based methods were used in a study to characterize surface und immune proteins of two vaccine strains of the human pathogen bacterium Bordetella pertussis (Tefon et al. 2011, Publication I). Moreover, a strategy for absolute protein quantification of a large fraction of one organism's cytoslic proteins was developed which combines two established proteomics methods. Here, selected proteins, whose concentration was determined by targeted mass spectrometry, were used to calibrate 2D gels (Maass et al. 2011, Publication II). The use of HPE-gels leads to 25 % more detectable 2D protein spots which can be quantified thereby showing a significant improved reproducibility. (Moche et al. 2013, Publication III). The new gelbased method for large-scale absolute protein quantification was applied to determine protein concentrations for more than 700 proteins of Bacillus subtilis during adaptation to glucose starvation and heat stress (Maass et al. 2014, Publication IV). The comparison of both stress conditions renders the possibility to differentiate between general and specific stress responses. Thereby the analysis was supported by calculation of protein costs and distribution of protein mass among ...
